name: powercpp
description: Powerful C/C++ Extension for Modern Developers

editor/context.when: resourceLangId == c || resourceLangId == cpp || resourceLangId == cuda-cpp || resourceLangId == objective-c || resourceLangId == objective-cpp

cpp.path.description: C/C++ binaries path. By default, the global search for the compiler and other utilities is used.

cpp.dbgAdapterEnv.description: Extra environment variables for the debug adapter.

cpp.dbgAdapterVerbose.description: Turns on verbose debug adapter logging.

program.description: Path to the program to debug.

stdio.description: Destination for stdio streams: null = send to debugger console or a terminal, "<path>" = attach to a file/tty/fifo.

enumDescriptions: Use VScode Debug Console for stdout and stderr. Stdin will be unavailable.

console.description: Terminal type to use. (This setting is a compatibility alias of 'terminal'.)
enumDescriptions: Use VScode Debug Console for stdout and stderr. Stdin will be unavailable.

initCommands.description: Initialization commands executed upon debugger startup.

preRunCommands.description: Commands executed just before the program is launched.

postRunCommands.description: Commands executed just after the program has been launched.

exitCommands.description: Commands executed at the end of debugging session.

expressions.description: The default evaluator type used for expressions.

sourceMap.description: Source path remapping between the build machine and the local machine.  Each item is a pair of remote and local path prefixes.

relativePathBase.description: Base directory used for resolution of relative source paths.  Defaults to "${workspaceFolder}".

sourceLanguages.description: A list of source languages to enable language-specific features for.

reverseDebugging.description: Enable reverse debugging (Requires reverse execution support in the debug server, see User's Manual for details).

program.description: Path to the program to attach to.

waitFor.description: Wait for the process to launch (MacOS only).

initCommands.description: Initialization commands executed upon debugger startup.

preRunCommands.description: Commands executed just before the program is attached to.

postRunCommands.description: Commands executed just after the program has been attached to.

exitCommands.description: Commands executed at the end of debugging session.

expressions.description: The default evaluator type used for expressions.

sourceMap.description: Source path remapping between the build machine and the local machine.  Each item is a pair of remote and local path prefixes.

sourceLanguages.description: A list of source languages to enable language-specific features for.

reverseDebugging.description: Enable reverse debugging (Requires reverse execution support in the debug server, see User's Manual for details).

initCommands.description: Initialization commands executed upon debugger startup.

targetCreateCommands.description: Commands that create a debug target.

exitCommands.description: Commands executed at the end of debugging session.

expressions.description: The default evaluator type used for expressions.

sourceMap.description: Source path remapping between the build machine and the local machine.  Each item is a pair of remote and local path prefixes.

relativePathBase.description: Base directory used for resolution of relative source paths.  Defaults to "${workspaceFolder}".

sourceLanguages.description: A list of source languages to enable language-specific features for.

reverseDebugging.description: Enable reverse debugging (Requires reverse execution support in the debug server, see User's Manual for details).

configurationSnippets.label: C/C++: Debug Auto
configurationSnippets.description: Launch a new instance of the automatically identified program.

configurationSnippets.label: C/C++: Debug Program
configurationSnippets.description: Launch a new instance of the specified program.

configurationSnippets.label: C/C++: Debug running by Path
configurationSnippets.description: Attach to a running instance of the specified program.

configurationSnippets.label: C/C++: Debug running by PID
configurationSnippets.description: Attach to a running process with the specified process id.

body.name: Attach PID
body.pid: ^"\${command:pickMyProcess}" // use \${command:pickProcess} to pick other users' processes

scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
